summary: This is an email from a forensic examiner to a NYO CART Coordinator regarding the status of Epstein evidence processing, referencing a color-coded spreadsheet and five pending items expected to be completed within days. The document is subject to a protective order.

persons.name: NYO CART Coordinator
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding Epstein evidence processing status.

persons.name: Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Author of the email, indicating they are preparing a spreadsheet and have five items pending completion.

connections.description: The forensic examiner is providing a status update on evidence processing to the coordinator.

events.title: Evidence Status Update
events.description: A senior forensic examiner sends an email update on the status of Epstein evidence processing, noting a color-coded spreadsheet and five pending items.

keyFacts: An evidence status update was sent on July 23, 2020, regarding the processing of Epstein-related evidence.
A color-coded spreadsheet was used to track evidence status, with five items still pending completion.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
The correspondence involves a Senior Forensic Examiner and a NYO CART Coordinator, indicating ongoing forensic analysis.
Pending items were expected to be completed by the following Monday or Tuesday.
